powergrid.model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.model.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Three-dimensional data structure for GameObjects.

    When the size of the Grid is (n * m * p), then the time it takes to access any GameObject in the Grid lies somewhere between O(1) and O(n*m).

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • objectclasses

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] objectclasses
        A list of classes that are recognized by the Grid as potential types for raw values. This field can be modified, but classes in this array will only be used if they define the following field:

        public static final int[] values

        The values in this int[] must be sorted ascending. Also, they must define a constructor with the following fields: (int,int,int,int), where the first three values represent a 3D Point, and the last int represents the raw value of the Object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid()
        Creates a new Grid.

    • Method Detail

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(Point p)
        Sets the offset to the given value. This does not change the location of the elements on the Grid, so the elements of this Grid may be in the wrong place after calling this method.
        Parameters:
        p - the new offset

      • size

        public int size()
        returns the amount of elements in the Grid
        Returns:
        the amount of elements in the Grid

      • set

        public GameObject set(Point p,
             GameObject o)
        Sets a GameObject at the given position and returns the GameObject previously at this position
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to set the GameObject to
        o - the GameObject to set
        Returns:
        the GameObject previously at Point p

      • set

        public GameObject set(Point p,
             int value)
        Sets a GameObject of the correct type to the specified Point.

        This method makes use of the objectclasses field to find the appropriate class for the given value.

        Parameters:
        p - the Point the GameObject has to be stored on
        value - the raw value for the object
        Returns:
        the GameObject previously at Point p.

      • delete

        public GameObject delete(Point p)
        removes the element stored at Point p from the Grid and returns this element. returns null if no such element was found
        Parameters:
        p - the position of the element to remove
        Returns:
        the GameObject at this Point

      • get

        public GameObject get(Point p)
        Returns the element at the given Point in the Grid
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to look up
        Returns:
        the value stored at Point p

      • purge

        public void purge()
        Reduces the memory this Grid occupies by rebuilding the internal structure of the Grid.

        Please note that this operation may take a long time to complete. Furthermore, future set() operations on this Grid may be slower due to reduced reserved space.

      • getXMLTree

        public XMLNode getXMLTree()
        creates an XML tree representation of the Grid and returns it.
        Returns:
        an XML tree representation of the Grid

      • fillFromXML

        public void fillFromXML(XMLNode root)
        parses the data from the provided XML structure if it represents a grid.

        Only XMLNodes with the tag "grid" will be accepted.

        Parameters:
        root - the root Node of the grid structure.

      • addAll

        public void addAll(java.util.HashMap<Point,?> objects)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns a XML-formatted representation of this Grid
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a XML-formatted representation of this Grid
